meanings.sent1: The constant rubbing corrades the surface of the table.
meanings.sent2: The rough sandpaper corrades the wood slowly.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy corrades the edges of the carpet with its sharp claws.
meanings.sent4: Time corrades memories like waves smoothing out rocks on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The old stone steps show where countless footsteps have corraded the stone over the years.

meanings.definition: To erode or deteriorate by friction
meanings.sent1: The harsh weather corrades the paint on the fence.
meanings.sent2: The constant use of the swing corrades the chains over time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel corrades the bird feeder trying to get to the seeds.
meanings.sent4: Negativity can corrade relationships faster than anything else.
meanings.sent5: The river corrades the banks, changing its course with each passing year.

meanings.sent1: She corrades the rust off the old metal lock with a wire brush.
meanings.sent2: The glacier slowly corrades the mountain, shaping it over centuries.
meanings.sent3: The chef corrades the skin off the potato with a sharp knife.
meanings.sent4: The wind corrades the sandstone cliffs, creating intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The artist corrades the canvas with a palette knife, adding texture to the painting.
